intro: Ardisia replicata, commonly known as the shining beauty or Chinese evergreen, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces bright red berries that are toxic to humans and animals. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ability to thrive in shaded environments. Ardisia replicata is also valued for its adaptability to various soil types and its use in traditional medicine in some regions.
